title: Comparative Evaluation of Data Decoupling Techniques for Federated Machine Learning with Database as a Service. (arXiv:2303.08371v1 [cs.DB])
abstract: Federated Learning (FL) is a machine learning approach that allows multiple clients to collaboratively learn a shared model without sharing raw data. However, current FL systems provide an all-in-one solution, which can hinder the wide adoption of FL in certain domains such as scientific applications. To overcome this limitation, this paper proposes a decoupling approach that enables clients to customize FL applications with specific data subsystems. To evaluate this approach, the authors develop a framework called Data-Decoupling Federated Learning (DDFL) and compare it with state-of-the-art FL systems that tightly couple data management and computation. tldr: 本文提出一种基于数据解耦技术的联邦机器学习方法，称之为DDFL，并评估其与紧密耦合数据管理和计算的最新FL系统的性能进行比较。实验结果表明，DDFL在训练时间、推理准确性和数据库查询时间方面具有可比性或更好的性能，同时提供了更多调整学习应用程序，特别是关于数据相关度量的选择。
